meanings.definition: An action or event regarded as morally or legally wrong and causing general public outrage.
meanings.sent1: The scandal involving the politician shocked everyone in town.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper reported on the scandal that rocked the community.
meanings.sent3: It was a scandal when the cat was caught stealing treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: The scandal at the school spread like wildfire among the students.
meanings.sent5: The scandal at the office made headlines across the city.

meanings.definition: A disgraceful or discreditable action, circumstance, or situation.
meanings.sent1: The scandal of the cheating scandal in the game tarnished the team's reputation.
meanings.sent2: She felt deep shame after the scandal of her mistake was revealed.
meanings.sent3: It was a scandal when the dog was caught digging through the trash.
meanings.sent4: The scandal of the broken promise left a mark on their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The scandal of the stolen cookies caused quite a stir at the party.
